A 6-month-old boy is brought to a pediatric unit because he fails to gain weight and has become increasingly weak to the point that he can no longer breast-feed. He is the second son of a healthy Caucasian couple, born by normal vaginal delivery after an uneventful pregnancy. Results of routine pediatric investigations after birth were unremarkable. Physical exam reveals mild cyanosis, shallow respiration, moderate hepatomegaly, an unusually large tongue (macroglossia), and generalized muscular flaccidity. Laboratory: normal complete blood count (CBC), electrolytes, glucose, blood urea nitrogen (BUN), and creatinine, but creatine kinase (CK) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT) are high. Chest X-ray and echocardiogram show extreme cardiomegaly with outflow tract obstruction and congestive heart failure. A 74-year-old man with a history of smoking notices blood in his chronic daily sputum production. He has no fever or chills, but has lost 10 lb in the past 6 months. On examination, he has bilateral expiratory wheezes, and his fingers are clubbed. There are no lymph nodes and the remaining examination is normal. CXR reveals a left hilar mass. Which of the following suggests that the tumor is a small cell lung cancer?

options.label: A
options.text: Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone (SIADH) secretion

questions.correct_answer: A. Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone (SIADH) secretion
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ • Paraneoplastic syndromes are classified as metabolic, neuromuscular, connective tissue, dermatologic, and vascular.
  • ↳ • Stevens-Johnson syndrome usually follows drug allergy. Acanthosis nigricans and other cutaneous manifestations (e.g., dermatomyositis) are rare (<1%). Clubbing is common and occurs in up to 30% of non-small cell lung cancers.
  • ↳ • The various endocrine syndromes occur in 12% of cases. At times, paraneoplastic syndromes may be the presenting finding in lung cancer or be the first sign of recurrence.
  • ↳ • Most occur with non-small cell lung cancer, but SIADH is more characteristic of small cell lung cancer.

questions.text: The following cancer is associated with high relapse rates. To reduce risk of relapse, prophylactic cranial irradiation is recommended in which of the following lung cancers.
The following statements about lung cancer is true

options.label: A
options.text: Small cell carcinoma accounts for 70% of lung cancers

options.label: B
options.text: OAT cell variant typically presents with cavitation

options.label: C
options.text: OAT cell variant typically associated with hilar adenopathy

questions.correct_answer: C. OAT cell variant typically associated with hilar adenopathy

Which of the following extra-intestinal manifestation is most commonly associated with ulcerative colitis as compared with crohn’s disease?

A 59-year-old female is brought to the causality with fever. skin flushing and an altered level of consciousness. Her blood pressure is 50/20 mmHg and her heart rate is l20/min. lf blood cultures are positive for E. coli, choose the correct structure shown in the image is responsible for this patient’s current condition?

A 9-year-old boy from a rural village is admitted due to fever, sore throat and difficulty breathing. His immunization status cannot be determined due to abscnce of records. Physical examination shows extensive, coalescing, gray pharyngeal exudate and cervical adenopathy. Several days after being admitted to the hospital, he dies of myocarditis and severe heart failure. The presence of which of the following would most likely have prevented this patient's death?

A 23-year-old pregnant woman is found to have chronic viral hepatitis B on liver biopsy. The presence of which of the following serologic markers is most likely to increase the risk of vertical transmission of the virus?

A 25-year-old man comes to the clinic with a lesion on his penis, He noted a painful ulcer on the right side of the penis 4 days ago and it has progressively increased in size since then. The patient has had no dysuria, hematuria or penile discharge. He is HIV-positive and is sexually active. The patient currently takes no medications. He appears comfortable and is afebrile. On genitourinary examination, there is a 1.5 cm ulceration on the right side of the base of the penis. this lesion is very tender and soft has irregular, ragged borders and is covered with grey exudate. There is no penile discharge. There is a palpable, tender, enlarged inguinal lymph node in the right groin. The examination is otherwise unremarkable. A scraping of the ulcer is performed. Gram smear shown in the image. PCR testing for herpes simplex virus is negative and darkfield microscopy reveals no organisms. Choose the right pathogen.

A 12 old male child is brought to the pediatrics department by his mother because of high fever, irritability and photophobia. He recently underwentventriculoperitoneal shunt placement for congenital hydrocephalus, On physical examination his temperature is 38.30C and passive flexion of the neck results in spontaneous flexion of the hips and knees. Blood cultures grow coagulase-negative Staphylococcus which is sensitive to novobiocin. Which of the following is the most important Virulence mechanism by which this bacterium causes disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Synthesis of an extracellular polysaccharide matrix

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of protein A on the cell wall

questions.correct_answer: A. Synthesis of an extracellular polysaccharide matrix

questions.text: A 3 year—old boy is brought to the clinic due to high fever, nasal discharge, and cough for 3 days. His family recently returned from a vacation in Goa. Physical examination shows an ill-appearing, febrile child. The patient has bilateral conjunctival injection and several small white spots with an erythematous base on his buccal mucosa as shown in the image. A review of the medical record shows parental refusal of preventive health services in favor of a "natural" approach to the child‘s health. Over the next several days. which of the following is most likely to develop?

A 30-year-old man comes to the clinic after a witnessed tonic-clonic seizure. The patient has no known medical problems. He works as an architect and owns a cat. He has no history of tuberculosis. On examination. he is afebrile and has no focal neurological deficits or meningeal signs. An HIV antibody test and aninterferon—gamma release assay test are negative. Chest x—ray is normal. An MRI of the brain reveals a 2.5 centimeters cyst within the left Sylvian fissure that has minimal enhancement and no associated edema suggestive of Neurocysticercosis. Which of the following is the most likely means of acquisition of the infection responsible for this patient‘s findings?

A 15-year-old boy is evaluated for fever, headache, malaise and cough 3 weeks after returning from summer camp. Lung auscultation is unremarkable. Chest x-ray reveals nodular infiltrates. The patient's blood samples are collected for analysis in anticoagulated tubes. which are transported submerged in ice. when taken out several minutes later, turbidity and clumping are noted. Warming the tube to body temperature leads to rapid dissolution of the clumps. Which of the following organisms is most likely responsible for this patient's condition?
Based on the life cycle shown in the image, Choose the correct clinical condition caused by this pathogen.

A 45-year-old man comes to the physician with a 6-month history of cough and fatigue. He also has experienced malaise and weight loss. He does not recall any sick contacts. The patient is a carpenter. He smokes 1 pack of cigarettes daily. Examination shows left lower lobe crackles. HIV testing is negative. Chest x-ray reveals a pulmonary infiltrate in the lower lobe of the left lung. Results from sputum potassium hydroxide preparation are shown in the image. Choose the correct pathogen.

A 25-year-old woman accidentally falls down a flight of stairs. After the fall, she is found to have partial loss of voluntary movement on the right side of her body and loss of pain and temperature sensation on the left side below the midthoracic region. Which of the following is the probable site of lesion?

options.label: A
options.text: Left half of spinal cord in upper thoracic region

options.label: B
options.text: Right half of spinal cord in upper thoracic region

options.label: C
options.text: Dorsal half of spinal cord in upper thoracic region

options.label: D
options.text: Sensory and motor pathways on right side of pons

questions.correct_answer: B. Right half of spinal cord in upper thoracic region

questions.text: Which of the following is correct about the Starling’s law of the heart?

options.label: B
options.text: Explains the increase in heart rate during exercise

options.label: C
options.text: Explains the increase in cardiac output that occurs when the venous return is increased

options.label: D
options.text: Explains the increase in cardiac output when the sympathetic stimulation to the heart is increased

questions.correct_answer: C. Explains the increase in cardiac output that occurs when the venous return is increased

questions.text: Spontaneous respiration ceases after which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Transection of the brain stem above the pons

options.label: B
options.text: Transection of the brain stem at the caudal end of the medulla

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: B. Transection of the brain stem at the caudal end of the medulla

questions.text: Find out the true and false statement regarding drug metabolism A. Acetaminophen, undergoes phase I reaction by CYP2E1 enzyme B. CYP3A4, 4 indicates family number C. DOC in esophageal candidiasis

Find out the true and false statement A. lumiracoxib is withdrawn because of the cardiovascular complications B. Piroxicam is short acting NSAID C. Nabumetone is the prodrug D. IV indomethacin is useful to maintain the patency of patent ductus arteriosus E. NSAID decrease the actions of lithium
questions.correct_answer: C. A-T, B-F, C-T, D-F, E-F

questions.text: Regarding antithyroid drugs find out the false statement

options.label: A
options.text: I131 has a t 1/2 of 8 days

options.label: C
options.text: Amiodarone inhibits release of T3 & T4 from thyroid follicle

options.label: D
options.text: Antineutrophilic cytoplasmic antibodies (ANCAs) development is the adverse effect of PTU

questions.correct_answer: C. Amiodarone inhibits release of T3 & T4 from thyroid follicle

questions.text: Regarding alosetron, find out the false statement

options.label: C
options.text: Causes adverse effects of ischemic colitis

questions.text: A 55yr old male patient with history of hypertension and angina, is on lisinopril. Atorvastatin & Aspirin. He was started on a drug X about one month back. Now he presents with fatigue, muscle pain & his serum creatinine level was raised. All of the following could be drug X except.
The investigator wants to assess an association between obesity and breast cancer. The study best suited for this purpose which is less time consuming is :
Which of the following is false regarding incidence :

options.label: A
options.text: It measures Rate at which new cases are occurring.

options.label: B
options.text: It represents risk of developing disease

questions.correct_answer: D. Not useful to take action

questions.text: Which of the following is correctly matched regarding adulterants and manifestatation:

A test for hepatitis C is performed for 400 patient with biopsy proven disease and 400 patient known to be free of the disease . The test shows positive results on 200 of the patients with the disease , and negative result on 360 of the patient without the disease . Which of the following is true regarding this test :
questions.correct_answer: A. Sensitivity is less than specificity

questions.text: All are true about p - value except :

options.label: A
options.text: Is the probability of committing Type - I error

options.label: C
options.text: Is the chance that the presence of difference is concluded when actually there is none

options.label: D
options.text: When p- value is less than alpha , the result is statistically significant

questions.correct_answer: B. Is equal t o 1- beta

questions.text: Patients initially presented with symptoms of fevers, chills, cough, and myalgias, however, progressed to significant respiratory distress and hemodynamic compromise. An early case-control study identified exposure to rodent feces as a risk factor for disease, thus a rodent-trapping operation was initiated. The likely source of infection is :

A school child suffering with nutritional deficiency was screened by mobile health team and was referred to district hospital for further management. Which of the following scheme stress more on screening and early intervention in children:

A worker who had been in the battery manufacturing unit for the last 20 years, reported to you with complaints of loss of appetite and abdominal colic of 2 weeks duration. You will prefer to investigate him for:

4-8 speakers interact infront of audience discussing about poverty alleviation in India. No set of speeches and no order of speeches . Audience can participate at the end of session . This type of helath education method is :
All are true about Primary health centre except:
As per national framework for malaria elimination in India , states with zero indigenous cases are classified as :
ASHA prompted primi for institutional delivery in an urban area of Maharashtra . How much incentives mother and ASHA will get according janani suraksha yojana?
Match the following colour codes of bags used for BMW management:
Transovarian transmission is seen in :
Which of the following is not included for children under this scheme shown below in the logo :
During Mental Status Examination, Judgement is tested on all of following parameters except?
What does Ultra Rapid cycling in Bipolar Mood disorder means?
questions.correct_answer: D. More than 4 episodes per month

questions.text: Delusion of grandiosity is seen in all, except? (JIPMER MAY 19)
All of the following are correct with respect to different grades of insight, except? (AIIMS MAY 19)

options.label: A
options.text: Grade III : Patient is aware of his illness, but blames it on others or external factors

options.label: B
options.text: Grade II : Slight awareness of being sick and needing help but denying it at the same time

options.label: C
options.text: Grade IV : Emotional awareness of the motives and feelings within, of the underlying meaning of symptoms

options.label: D
options.text: Grade I : Complete denial of illness

questions.correct_answer: C. Grade IV : Emotional awareness of the motives and feelings within, of the underlying meaning of symptoms

questions.text: In history taking in psychiatry, personal history includes all except: (***)
Which of the following blocks has the LONGEST duration of action when bupivacaine is administered?
Which of the following factors will cause falsely low reading on the value of pulse oximetry except?
Regarding malignant hyperthermia, which of the following statements are true?

options.label: B
options.text: Always occurs within the first few hours of exposure to triggering agent.

options.label: C
options.text: Dantrolene 2.5 mg/kg IV up to a maximum of 10 mg/kg is the drug of choice.

options.label: D
options.text: Masseter spasm is the first sign.

questions.correct_answer: C. Dantrolene 2.5 mg/kg IV up to a maximum of 10 mg/kg is the drug of choice.

questions.text: Identify the instrument given in the image and its correct use?

options.label: A
options.text: Automatic external defibrillator (AED) which is used for ventricular fibrillation

options.label: B
options.text: Automated external defibrillator (AED) which used for ventricular tachycardia

options.label: C
options.text: Manual defibrillator which is used for ventricular fibrillation

options.label: D
options.text: Automated external decompressor (AED) which is used for ventricular fibrillation

questions.correct_answer: B. Automated external defibrillator (AED) which used for ventricular tachycardia

questions.text: A 22-year-old patient is anesthetized for resection of a temporal lobe tumour. Preoperatively, he is lethargic and confused. After induction of general anesthesia, which of the following would be the MOST appropriate drug to control systemic arterial blood pressure during direct laryngoscopy and tracheal intubation?

A 17-year-old male with AIDS presents with worsening exertional dyspnea, fever, and a nonproductive cough. His temperature is 102 F, heart rate 120 beats/min, and respiratory rate 19. A physical exam reveals mild crackles and rhonchi bilaterally. A chest x-ray shows diffuse bilateral infiltrates. He has no known drug allergies. What is the best initial treatment?

options.label: C
options.text: Intravenous corticosteroids followed by IV trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole

options.label: D
options.text: Intravenous corticosteroids followed by IV levofloxacin

questions.correct_answer: C. Intravenous corticosteroids followed by IV trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole

questions.text: A 1-year old boy presents with a persistent cough for the past 5 days. He has had several episodes of pneumonia and upper respiratory infections since he was born. He also has several skin infections. He is in the 10th percentile for weight and 5th percentile for height, but at birth, he was in the 50th percentile. A dihydrorhodamine test is abnormal and peripheral blood smear does not indicate hemolytic anemia. What is the most likely cause of this patient’s disease?

A 12-year-old with perennial aeroallergies has severe persistent asthma which is not well controlled with step 5 therapy with high dose inhaled corticosteroids and long-acting beta agonist. Which of the following options should be considered? Choices:

options.label: D
options.text: Discontinuation of the long-acting beta2 agonist

questions.text: Which of the following is the dose of ETT epinephrine in neonates?
Which of the following is the best indicator of adequacy of ventilation in neonates?
Which of the following is autosomal recessive?

A woman with bipolar disorder seeks obstetric care during her second trimester. When obtaining her history, the obstetrician learns that she has been taking lithium daily. Prenatal counseling of this woman should include a discussion that maternal lithium use can lead to what potential teratogenic effect on a fetus?

A pregnant woman initially presents for prenatal care at 28 weeks’ gestation. Upon review of her history, she reports systemic hypertension in her past medical history and medication use of captopril throughout her pregnancy. You counsel her on the potential teratogenic effects of captopril. Of the following, the most likely fetal risk associated with maternal captopril is:

A male infant is born at 37 2/7 weeks’ gestation to a woman with a history of a seizure disorder. Her seizures have been very difficult to manage, so she remained on antiepileptic medication during this pregnancy. Soon after birth, the pediatrician examines the infant and identifies a small lumbosacral myelomeningocele, hypospadias, and postaxial polydactyly on both hands. Which medication is most likely to account for these clinical findings?

The NRP recommendations about suctioning of infants delivered with meconium-stained amniotic fluid (MSAF) has changed over the years as new evidence has emerged. Based upon the current published evidence, and most recent NRP guidelines, which of the following statements is FALSE?

options.label: A
options.text: Among infants who are depressed at birth, direct suctioning of the trachea is not associated with a reduced incidence of meconium aspiration syndrome (MAS).

options.label: B
options.text: Among infants who are depressed at birth, direct suctioning of the trachea is not associated with reduced mortality.

options.label: C
options.text: Meconium management strategies should be altered based on the consistency of the meconium (i.e., “thin” versus “thick”).

options.label: D
options.text: There is no benefit in routine endotracheal intubation with direct suctioning of the trachea in vigorous newborns.

options.label: E
options.text: There is no benefit to suctioning the oropharynx at the perineum, prior to the delivery of the shoulders.

questions.correct_answer: C. Meconium management strategies should be altered based on the consistency of the meconium (i.e., “thin” versus “thick”).

questions.text: Match the significant ages in table A with the dental phenomenon given in table B?
The photograph of a dead body of a right handed person. It is highly suggestive of?

A public prosecutor asks prosecution witness ‘you have said to police during inquest that you saw the alleged accused running away from the scene of crime’ yes or no? Now you are denying that why? This can be done by public prosecutor during?

options.label: C
options.text: Can not ask leading question as he is prosecution witness

questions.text: In a dead body from a road traffic accident during autopsy, Sparrow Foot lesions are seen. These will be present at?
Upon pressure test on a dead body, the lividity does not shift at all. This means?

options.label: A
options.text: The time since death is less than 6 hours

options.label: B
options.text: The death is due to hanging

options.label: D
options.text: The person has been dead for more than 12 hours

questions.correct_answer: D. The person has been dead for more than 12 hours

questions.text: Study the given image and comment on the TNM staging of the patient :

A 30-year-old male presents with foul smelling ear discharge. On examination external auditory canal was full of granulations and the tympanic membrane appeared as the picture given below. Most appropriate next step in the management would be:

options.label: A
options.text: Topical antibiotics and decongestants for 4 weeks

questions.text: 21 yrs old male patient with a one year history of development of nasal obstruction on the left with intermittent epistaxis in several opportunities, the latest episode of two days, accompanied by clear rhinorrhea, progressive decrease in olfaction, intermittent bilateral hearing loss at three months of development and weight loss of approximately 10 kg in one year. One examination palpation one lymph node of size 3 cm* 2cm at level III. On oral cavity examination palatal palsy was suspected. Choose the most appropriate diagnosis.
Choose the most appropriate statement regarding “Diagnosis of otosclerosis”

options.label: B
options.text: Notch at 1000 is seen on pure tone audiometric thresholds with air conduction.

options.label: D
options.text: Differential diagnosis from congenital footplate fixation is difficult as the conductive hearing loss is also progressive.

questions.correct_answer: A. Patient have soft spoken speech.

questions.text: Match the correct mechanism of referred otalgia in given tumors
Identify the bone
A patient has intact otoacoustic emissions and absent wave V on the ABR. Which condition does this patient have?
An Onodi cell results from an exaggerated posterior pneumatization of which of the following cells?

A 27-year-old man presents with complaints of chronic nasal congestion. About 2 months earlier, he had an upper respiratory tract infection with rhinorrhea and nasal congestion. Since then he continues to have severe nasal congestion for which he uses oxymetazoline nasal twice daily. Physical examination swollen turbinates and no purulent discharge. What is the most appropriate treatment?

options.label: D
options.text: Discontinue oxymetazoline and start steroid nasal spray.

questions.correct_answer: D. Discontinue oxymetazoline and start steroid nasal spray.

questions.text: A 2 year old child presents to emergency with high grade fever and respiratory distress. He has drooling of saliva and her mother told he has been refusing feeds since yesterday. On oral examination there was a bulge on posterior pharyngeal wall on one side of midline. Xray soft tissue neck lateral view is shown in picture. What is the possible diagnosis?

Resolution of microscope is 200nM. Which of the following is correct interpretation?

options.label: A
options.text: Structure should be minimum 200nM to be visible

options.label: B
options.text: Structure of 2 nM will appear 2 mm on microscopy

options.label: C
options.text: Two structures to be discriminated should be separated by minimum distance of 200nM

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: C. Two structures to be discriminated should be separated by minimum distance of 200nM

questions.text: Capsulated organisms are best killed with the help of which of the following?
Clear cell tumor of ovary falls under which category of tumor?
Histological examination from the thyroid swelling in a patient suffering from constipation and cold intolerance is as follows. What is likely diagnosis?
Histological examination from a salivary gland tumor shows dense lymphoid stroma with dual layered cells showing palisading. What is the likely diagnosis?

A female presents with galactorrhoea and amenorrhoea. Imaging shows a tumor in sellar region. Histology is as shown in the image. At places invasion into cavernous sinus is seen. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 26 year old male has been complaining of back pain for last one year. His pain radiates from the back to right buttock and thigh down to legs. On examination he has mild sensory loss over dorsum of foot and weakness of extension of great toe on the right side. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis ?
questions.correct_answer: A. PIVD L4-L5 Postero lateral / Paracentral

questions.text: Identify the test being performed in this image-

A 42 year old female presents with tingling and numbness in right hand that awakens her in the middle of the night for last two weeks. She also gives history of being treated for diabetes and hypothyroidism for last 3 years by an endocrinologist. Which of the following ain’t true about this condition from the following options ?

options.label: A
options.text: Splintage is helpful only in few initial months of onset of symptoms

options.label: B
options.text: Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

options.label: C
options.text: Durakn’s Test is the most specific clinical test in the diagnosis

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most common focal compression neuropathy

questions.correct_answer: B. Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

questions.text: A 9 year old child is brought by his parents with chief complains of pain and swelling in right thigh which have exaggerated since last couple of weeks. His Thorough examination was done earlier which revealed Increased TLC , Neutrophils and ESR. His repeated blood cultures went Negative. X Ray Was done which showed lesion in femur mainly in diaphysis with some laminated periosteal reaction. What is the NEXT investigation that should be done ?
About fracture healing, all are true, except :

options.label: A
options.text: Lower limb long bones heal faster than other bones

options.label: B
options.text: Fracture in children heal faster than in adults

options.label: C
options.text: Oblique and spiral fractures heal faster than transverse fractures

questions.correct_answer: A. Lower limb long bones heal faster than other bones
